About Me

Hi, I'm Luke Ollivierre, a Division 1 tennis player at St. Bonaventure University, where I'm also pursuing a degree in Computer Science. Born and raised in Barbados, I've always been driven by a passion for sports and technology.

Tennis has taught me discipline, perseverance, and strategic thinking, qualities I aim to apply in my academic and professional journey. I'm excited to make an impact in my field of study.

BONA101

In this course, I explored the characteristics and functions of community and diversity, which helped me understand how to belong and thrive at St. Bonaventure. I learned effective learning strategies, aspects of college preparation, and career development.

CS-131

This foundational course introduced me to the object-oriented approach to software design using Java. I developed skills in software design, implementation, and testing while also gaining an understanding of basic computer organization and source code translation. Starting with no prior Java experience, I became comfortable working with Java and applying programming principles effectively.

CSL-131

This course accompanied CS-131. Concepts which were learned in CS-131 were applied and tested in this lab.

CS-101

Through this course, I gained a comprehensive understanding of the history, social implications, and fundamental principles of computing. I explored how computing has shaped the world and empowers progress across various fields.

ENG-101

This composition course helped me build a strong foundation in writing by developing a clear writing process. I learned to generate content effectively and refine my work to address structure, style, and mechanics.

Men's Tennis

In the fall season I went 4-3 in doubles with a win at The Big Four invitational over Niagara University.
